Helps taking users from emails to necess: Helps taking users from emails to necessary pages on your site
Allows adding elements with custom code: Allows adding elements with custom code in emails
Allows applying filters to images and pl: Allows applying filters to images and placing text over them
Allows setting thumbnail images & play b: Allows setting thumbnail images & play buttons for videos
Adds a countdown to a specific date. Use: Adds a countdown to a specific date. Use the timer in emails for promotions, launches, and events.

Outlook for Windows does not have a supp: Outlook for Windows does not have a support for the border radius property. We recommend enabling the Outlook support option.
It only works with CSS styles, so it is: It only works with CSS styles, so it is not supported by Outlook on Windows. We recommend enabling the Support for Outlook option.

Creates an anchor for this element. Anch: Creates an anchor for this element. Anchor links in emails are designed to make navigation easier. They help take readers to specific places in the email without the need to scroll. Learn more about how it works and how to create one with Stripo.

<p>The header area is a place where comp: The header area is a place where companies usually put their logo, contact details, menus, and so on. It inherits the styles set for the header area.
<p>The content area is the part of the e: The content area is the part of the email that is filled with content modules and blocks.
<p>The footer area is a place for contac: The footer area is a place for contact details, social media icons, an additional menu, etc. It inherits the styles set for the Footer area.
<p>The info area can be put above the he: The info area can be put above the header (in this case, it contains preview links); it can be put below the footer (in this case, it has unsubscribe links, terms of use, privacy policy, etc.).

The background image of the stripe. The: The background image of the stripe. The image will not be displayed in an Outlook app on Windows email clients. We recommend choosing a stripe background color similar to the selected image as a fallback
Create or select a condition to show the: Create or select a condition to show the recipients different content depending on whether a specified condition is met for a specific email recipient. Learn more.
Provide a description of this condition: Provide a description of this condition and its effects. Character limit: 500.
Line wrapping is carried out character-b: Line wrapping is carried out character-by-character so that the text is within the specified block width. The option does not work for Chinese, Korean, and Japanese text.

The background image of the structure. T: The background image of the structure. The image will not be displayed in an Outlook app on Windows email clients. We recommend choosing a structure background color similar to the selected image as a fallback
The background image of the container. T: The background image of the container. The image will not be displayed in an Outlook app on Windows email clients. We recommend choosing a container background color similar to the selected image as a fallback
Background image for the entire email. S: Background image for the entire email. Some email clients (Windows 10 Mail, Android 4.4, the Gmail app for iOS, and Android for non-Gmail accounts) do not support background images. Thus, we recommend choosing a background color for the entire email similar to the selected image as a fallback.
Repetition of the email background image: Repetition of the email background image. In Outlook for Windows, the image will be repeated in any case, regardless of whether this option is enabled or not. To bypass the Outlook limitation, you need to create an image in a third-party editor of the needed color and size so that it fits the entire background size, apply the required graphics to it, upload it, and center-align it in the email. The dimensions of such a background image should be at least 1,920 pixels in width, and the height should be equal to the height of the email.

Options of this section help you to styl: Options of this section help you to style message content that is used for informing, for example, a preheader text section, view in browser text and link, or after Footer text like unsubscribing options or copyrights.
Change the position of containers on mob: Change the position of containers on mobile devices. This allows the right container on desktop to appear on top of the left container on mobile instead of below it by default.
Containers of the structure will be loca: Containers of the structure will be located one below the other on mobile devices
Enable the right-to-left (RTL) text dire: Enable the right-to-left (RTL) text direction to build emails easily without coding for recipients using RTL scripts, such as Arabic, Hebrew, Persian, Urdu, etc.

This option will add campaign parameters: This option will add campaign parameters (UTM tags) to all URLs in the email when it is exported from Stripo, allowing you to track your campaign’s results in Google Analytics.
This allows you to add your own paramete: This allows you to add your own parameters for all links at one time. If you need to add a unique parameter for some link you could add it in the options of a specific link.
To activate the Drag & Drop function of: To activate the Drag & Drop function of the editor please make sure you have adapted your custom HTML code in accordance with Stripo template guidelines.
Connecting a Data Source lets you activa:
Connecting a Data Source lets you activate the SMART properties to automatically import content from your source into the email. In this way, you simplify and speed up the email production process.

This forces the accordion to only allow: This setting ensures that the accordion allows only one section to be expanded at a time. When a section is expanded, any other open sections will automatically close.
